content: Is it understood that if one makes a point we should expect either an acceptance of that point or a counter point? I "assume" so.... But the real question is, if one makes a point or a counter point, shouldn't they at least be close to equal so that they may be judged on their merits and it determined by either side if one actually made a point or not? Maybe that's why so many have left in the past, I mean, if you state a point and one's response is or their "counter" is a talking point, is it really worth it? Why post about important issues or causes and not actually want to debate them? If I start a thread "Obama is the greatest President ever" I should be ready with facts, opinions, examples, etc. that back up my claim or point. Likewise, I would expect those who have a counter point to do the same. JMHO....wait a minute, did I even make a point?
